title: Ad Champs in general just have better itemization...
body: How about we do something to fix that, and then we see if adc's are still considered op?

replies.body: Instead of giving ad champions worse itemization why not give tanks and mages better? Tanks and mages seem to have so few options with so few worthwhile choices.

>
> Instead of giving ad champions worse itemization why not give tanks and mages better? Tanks and mages seem to have so few options with so few worthwhile choices.

are you nuts ?
its still tank meta, and now riot has added lethality meta to it :/
tanks are still op .-.

This is not a lethality meta.

This is a "Duskblade is fucking broken" meta.
Only in solo queue, where no one plays tanks that makes building into lethality useless by 30 minutes.
My top laner says, "can i jg, im not good at top". Now, I like to play top. But I said, which jg you going? He said Noc. I said, nope, you're not jg.

>This is a "Opblade of Brokendarr" meta.

FIFY
Tanks are definitely broken, but I do agree mages should get some better gear for situations.

The issue is only some tanks are broken. In s1-2 if you wanted to play tank, you could literally take anyone and just build tank. Now unless you are one of 5 champions, there is no point in playing tank. To top it off if you build damage, you get nuked almost instantly... so there is a whole group of champions that are left almost unplayable unless you are literally a OTP.

I never actually suggested giving them worse itemization, I just would really like to see something actually done about itemization in general. They have had this same issue since season 1-2 when they had the meta golem build 

http://img-9gag-fun.9cache.com/photo/1458923_700b.jpg

Oh look damage items that also offer defense. They removed atmas for a reason, and then all they did was re-add the items in the form of black cleaver titanic and etc etc etc....

Some others they removed without a valid reason, like zephyr. 
Loved getting that with ninja tabi when there wasn't much magic damage to worry about.
Oh yea, but never forget actual meaningful tank items like 1500 hp (s1) 1200 hp (s2-3) warmogs, or force of nature, the list goes on...

Indeed, though it would be nice if they brought back some meaningful choice.
Like getting force of nature for boosted regeneration, or warmogs for massive health; not one item that does a little of both but neither incredibly well, as that often leads to balance problems.
Syndra was pretty bad before MYMU for a long time tho...

It isn't just about buffing itemization, its about allowing a larger variety to give them the same playing field. Its like playing DnD at level 20. While the warrior is still swinging his sword, mages are playing with rockets and hand grenades.

Real talk, fuck casters in D&D. 

Resistant to late game threats, which are primarily mind-affecting. 

More utility than anyone else. 

Invalidates rogue's skillchecks with specific spells for any situation. 

More AoE+damage than anyone else. 

Basically no cost has to be put towards gear. 

Landing spells isn't an issue in the large majority of cases, unlike attacks.

Positioning literally doesn't matter at all. Just have line of sight and you're golden.
Yeah, mages need better itemization. They have like one item for every situation while ADC's have three.
It's simple, nerf Orianna and Syndra while buffing some mage items! Or nerf overbearing ones like Morellonomicon.

And while we're at it, lets nerf lethality so adc's aren't all building duskblade, then buff some of the assassins that need it (Talon, Zed),

I mean, lethality was made for assassins, and since duskblade has become popular, I have actually seen more ADCs mid lane than Zed. I actually saw a Duskblade Graves mid once... yet I still don't see assassins

Maybe adding a tier of items that provide relatively little ap (40 to 60), but more in terms of defense or utility. My only issue is that I don't want to see mages building 5 defense focused items and still one shotting people. I've had enough tank ekko for my lifetime. I don't need tank ekko with 400-500 AP riding my ass. And maybe adding another 100 ap item that is just AP and some defense stats.
{{item:3170}} is a pretty good start tbh
By a long shot.
GIVE US DEATHFIRE GRASP
Rather not have burst mages shove everyone else out again.
In this meta of percent damage/shield stacking, I think they'll be just fine

But what about when this meta passes over into anything else due to nerfs, direct or not.  It'd feel incredibly wrong if they just deleted the item again after the meta passes.  Also reintroducing it kinda leaves Luden's Echo without a job.
Luden's echo was never really meant for assassins. Champions like Vel'Koz and Orianna will still build Luden's. Even before, assassins were pretty garbage.
OKay, fair points.
It would be a Deathfire vs lethality meta and the end goal is still the same thing: one shot everything.
An AP item to build out of {{item:3024}} would be a great addition.

Sad thing is Mages are still better than Assassins whenever there isn't a broken AD item like current Duskblade or Cleaver in the past.
What is the point of this thread? AD is used for auto attacks as well as scaling for spells, obviously there is a bigger item pool.
Because non-Ad champions can't get what they need to play properly...

I don't see you making suggestions for new AP items. Looks more like a "the grass is greener on the other side" kind of comment. And as sparse as your original post is I wonder how you are even getting upvoted, this is spam level. There is no actual substance.

or the minimalist post design was to allow people to comment more freely. It fosters discussion when you don't try and force people to do something a certain way. I feel like thats why you see a lot of s1-s2 players make posts that they are leaving the game because it is a different game. 

I remember being able to build any champ any way you wanted in s1. s2 rolled around and they removed itemization options. In fact they have even removed ad itemization options. The issues were that they never allowed all of the classes access to the same stat benefits or slot efficiency. Look at dodge. You had the highest dodge stat on phantom dancer... so it was the squishy adc's that had the best chance of survival due to auto attacks from a tank. I do also remember doing 100% dodge builds... people would even stack 4 phantom dancers on rammus for the dodge stat alone. 

So then what happens, in my opinion, is that you have to make champions specifically more powerful, or nerf them, because of access to itemization. If you can't access those stats through items you can never be viable without innately having them. Thus the "tanks are op" is (somewhat) true because without items they are inherently stronger. However, that also creates a balance issue because then when itemization does favor tanks they go over the top. Otherwise they are always underwhelming to play.
